meanings.definition: To write (a book, article, etc.) in collaboration with another person.
meanings.sent1: She cowrote a story with her friend.
meanings.sent3: The two friends cowrote a play that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Together, they cowrote a masterpiece that touched many hearts.
meanings.sent5: He cowrote a script that became a bestseller.

meanings.sent1: They cowrote a novel last year.
meanings.sent2: She cowrote an article with her colleague.
meanings.sent3: After they cowrote the report, they celebrated with cake.
meanings.sent4: He cowrote a poem that echoed through time.
meanings.sent5: The team cowrote a research paper that won an award.
